speaker: SHEPHERD
text: I would there were no age between ten and

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: three-and-twenty, or that youth would sleep out the

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: rest, for there is nothing in the between but getting

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: wenches with child, wronging the ancientry, stealing,

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: fighting—Hark you now. Would any but these

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: boiled brains of nineteen and two-and-twenty hunt

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: this weather? They have scared away two of my best

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: sheep, which I fear the wolf will sooner find than

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: the master. If anywhere I have them, ’tis by the

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: seaside, browsing of ivy. Good luck, an ’t be thy will,

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: what have we here? Mercy on ’s, a bairn! A very

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: pretty bairn. A boy or a child, I wonder? A pretty

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: one, a very pretty one. Sure some scape. Though I

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: am not bookish, yet I can read waiting-gentlewoman

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: in the scape. This has been some stair-work,

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: some trunk-work, some behind-door work. They

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: were warmer that got this than the poor thing is

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: here. I’ll take it up for pity. Yet I’ll tarry till my son

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: come. He halloed but even now.—Whoa-ho-ho!

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Hilloa, loa!

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: What, art so near? If thou ’lt see a thing to

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: talk on when thou art dead and rotten, come hither.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: What ail’st thou, man?

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I have seen two such sights, by sea

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: and by land—but I am not to say it is a sea, for it is

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: now the sky; betwixt the firmament and it, you

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: cannot thrust a bodkin’s point.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Why, boy, how is it?

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I would you did but see how it chafes,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: how it rages, how it takes up the shore. But that’s

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: not to the point. O, the most piteous cry of the poor

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: souls! Sometimes to see ’em, and not to see ’em.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Now the ship boring the moon with her mainmast,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: and anon swallowed with yeast and froth, as you’d

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: thrust a cork into a hogshead. And then for the land

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: service, to see how the bear tore out his shoulder-bone,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: how he cried to me for help, and said his

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: name was Antigonus, a nobleman. But to make an

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: end of the ship: to see how the sea flap-dragoned it.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: But, first, how the poor souls roared and the sea

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: mocked them, and how the poor gentleman roared

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: and the bear mocked him, both roaring louder than

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: the sea or weather.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Name of mercy, when was this, boy?

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Now, now. I have not winked since I

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: saw these sights. The men are not yet cold under

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: water, nor the bear half dined on the gentleman.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: He’s at it now.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Would I had been by to have helped the old

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: man.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I would you had been by the ship side,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: to have helped her. There your charity would have

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: lacked footing.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Heavy matters, heavy matters. But look

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: thee here, boy. Now bless thyself. Thou met’st with

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: things dying, I with things newborn. Here’s a sight

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: for thee. Look thee, a bearing cloth for a squire’s

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: child. Look thee here. Take up, take up, boy. Open

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: ’t. So, let’s see. It was told me I should be rich by

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: the fairies. This is some changeling. Open ’t. What’s

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: within, boy?

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: You’re a made old

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: man. If the sins of your youth are forgiven you,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: you’re well to live. Gold, all gold.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: This is fairy gold, boy, and ’twill prove so.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Up with ’t, keep it close. Home, home, the next way.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: We are lucky, boy, and to be so still requires

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: nothing but secrecy. Let my sheep go. Come, good

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: boy, the next way home.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Go you the next way with your

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: findings. I’ll go see if the bear be gone from the

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: gentleman and how much he hath eaten. They are

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: never curst but when they are hungry. If there be

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: any of him left, I’ll bury it.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: That’s a good deed. If thou mayest discern

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: by that which is left of him what he is, fetch me to

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: th’ sight of him.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Marry, will I, and you shall help to

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: put him i’ th’ ground.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: ’Tis a lucky day, boy, and we’ll do good

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: deeds on ’t.
